definition: to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
(jocularly) a day of frenetic online spending, such as Singles' Day

sentences.english: Chop and freeze veggies such as onions and peppers, too.
sentences.chinese: 素菜也要剁好并冷冻，比如洋葱和辣椒。

sentences.english: Remember, we have shears that cut through bone in the kitchen。
sentences.chinese: 别忘了，厨房里有我们用来剁骨头用的菜刀。

sentences.english: Next time I have a nagging hang-nail, I'll just cut off my foot.
sentences.chinese: 下次我脚指甲长了，我就把脚给剁了。

sentences.english: Wash beef, pat dry and mince. Stir in seasonings gradually until well-mixed.
sentences.chinese: 牛肉洗净，印干，剁烂，慢慢拌入调味料至均匀。

sentences.english: A:Don't you agree that all teh thieves should be punished by cuttin off their fingers?
sentences.chinese: 你不认为小偷应该被剁掉手指吗？

sentences.english: The chief chef chopped the tough beef with a sharp knife.
sentences.chinese: 大厨师用利刃剁韧牛肉。

sentences.english: The first is made with pounded shrimp paste, chopped shrimps and shredded bamboo shoots.
sentences.chinese: 前者是用剁烂的虾酱，碎虾肉和碎竹笋制作。

sentences.english: Chop the head of pepper, you resist the temptation to live?
sentences.chinese: 剁椒鱼头的诱惑，你抵挡的住吗？

sentences.english: Chicken Rice whacks it once with the side of her cleaver , resulting in wonderfully tender pieces of meat.
sentences.chinese: “鸡肉饭女士”忙着剁鸡肉再切成片放在米饭的上边。

sentences.english: Monday's special is fish head with chopped pepper.
sentences.chinese: 星期一的特色菜是剁椒鱼头。

definition: to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
to scrape the meat from bones/to pick (teeth etc)/to weed out
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
